text: {{Infobox settlement |name = Chimborazo |official_name = Province of Chimborazo |other_name = |native_name = |nickname = |settlement_type = Province |total_type = |motto = |image_skyline = Chimborazo 05.jpg |imagesize = |image_caption = Chimborazo volcano |image_flag = Bandera Provincia Cotopaxi.svg |flag_size = |image_seal = |seal_size = |image_shield = |shield_size = |image_blank_emblem = |blank_emblem_type = |blank_emblem_size = |image_map = Chimborazo in Ecuador (+Galapagos).svg |mapsize = |map_caption = Chimborazo Province in Ecuador |image_map1 = Chimborazo.JPG |mapsize1 = |map_caption1 = Cantons of Chimborazo Province |image_dot_map = |dot_mapsize = |dot_map_caption = |dot_x = |dot_y = |pushpin_map = |pushpin_label_position = |pushpin_map_caption = |pushpin_mapsize = |subdivision_type = Country |subdivision_name = Ecuador |seat_type = Capital |seat = Riobamba |government_footnotes = |government_type = |leader_title = Provincial Prefect |leader_name = |established_title = Legal establishment |established_date = June 25, 1826 |established_title1 = |established_date1 = |named_for = |area_magnitude = |unit_pref = |area_footnotes = |area_total_km2 = 6499.72 |area_land_km2 = |area_water_km2 = |area_total_sq_mi = |area_land_sq_mi = |area_water_sq_mi = |area_water_percent = |elevation_footnotes = |elevation_m = |elevation_ft = |elevation_max_m = |elevation_max_ft = |elevation_min_m = |elevation_min_ft = |population_as_of = 2010 census |population_footnotes = |population_note = |population_total = 458581 |population_density_km2 = auto |population_density_sq_mi= |timezone = ECT |utc_offset = -5 |postal_code_type = |postal_code = |area_code = |registration_plate = H |website = |footnotes = }} Chimborazo is a province in Ecuador. The capital is Riobamba. It is a home to a section of Sangay National Park. The province has Chimborazo (6,267 m), Ecuador's highest mountain. == Cantons == The province is divided into 10 cantons. The following table lists each with its population at the time of the 2001 census, its area in square kilometres (km²), and the name of the canton seat or capital.Cantons of Ecuador. Statoids.com. Retrieved 4 November 2009. Canton Pop. (2001) Area (km²) Seat/Capital Alausí 45,230 1,644 Alausí Chambo 13,300 163 Chambo Chunchi 12,860 273 Chunchi Colta 45,130 829 Cajabamba Cumandá 17,470 159 Cumandá Guamote 57,110 1,216 Guamote Guano 48,080 460 Guano Pallatanga 12,270 377 Pallatanga Penipe 6,980 370 Penipe Riobamba 261,360 980 Riobamba ==References==
